    <tag0:updated>2018-01-10T16:42:33.673Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">View Commercial Loan Details</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">For Commercial Loans sourced by BaNCS the customer can view Commercial Loan accounts; transaction activity; and other information if they have the appropriate access rights to the loan.

Information available:
Last four account number
Open Date
Current Balance
Interest Rate
Next Payment Date
Next Payment Amount
Interest YTD
Loan Term
Prior Year Interest
Transaction activity: date; transaction type (credit, debit, fee); Description (Payment;Fee;Draw); Status (Cleared,Scheduled,In progress); Interest; (Principal Amount); Amount</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">Payment To Eligible Commercial Loan (Quick Transfers)</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">For Commercial Loans sourced by BaNCS the customer can select a loan account for payment transfer provided they have the appropriate access rights to the loan.

Access rights are managed by BaNCS and are defined by BaNCS Channel Access Rules - reference linked requirement "BaNCS Commercial Loan Product Access Rights"</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-01-18T19:25:25.515Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Commercial Loan Transaction Descriptions</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Transaction Descriptions will match Statement descriptions*, the description will be a new combined field.

Tran Codes, defined in Online banking Core Admin by Product, will match Consumer Loan (Release 1) Tran Codes and descriptions:

CREDIT
FEE CREDIT
DEBIT
FEE DEBIT

BaNCS maintains a configuration table that translates real tran codes to one of the above with an appropriate description.

These descriptions are sent to Online Banking with transactions during the batch process and thus will display with transactions in Online Banking.

This same BaNCS table is used to define the description on the Statements

*Note: In some special cases the Online description will vary to the Statement descriptions e.g. one online transaction may be a combined payment of principal and interest so the description would be generic "Payment received"</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-01-18T19:38:45.797Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Commercial Loan Login Data Updates</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">At Customer login the following data elements are updated in Online Banking for Commercial Loans:

Account RCIF product type (e.g. CLOAN)
BaNCS product code/sub code * digit
Channel access flags (2)
Account status
Customer/Account Relationship type
Open Date (any other dates?)
Current Balance
Available Balance
Note: Transaction details are only updated during the nightly batch process.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">CL - Closed commercial loans are not visible online</tag0:title>

    <tag0:updated>2018-01-20T08:10:16.680Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL No Account Type Updates</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">The batch process will not update Online Banking if the Product Code/Type has changed for the loan account.

The product code/type update does occurs for other account types but not for commercial loan account types from BaNCS as due to the product simplification these account product code/types are static over the lifetime of the loan.

The data is however provide in the Type 1 loan extract file:

Data Element

Description

Batch/OB Action

AccountType/AcctSubTyp

Eight digit code for Product type

OB Product code prefixes this code with "CLB". This is NOT updated by the batch process, only by OB web-services</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">CL Closed Account - No longer status 9</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Verify that accounts that were previously sent over as type 9, that are no longer type 9 and have a balance are included in the account list.

Requirement: Commercial Loan accounts that have a status of closed are not to be accessible in Online Banking. The status information is provided in the Type 1 extract file:

Data Element	Description	Batch/OB Action
Account Status	Current status of account	Stored in OB and updated by batch and web-services . If closed batch and web-services will disassociate account from OB customer profile.</tag0:summary>

Data Element	Description	Batch/OB Action
Account Status	Current status of account	Stored in OB and updated by batch and web-services . If closed batch and web-services will disassociate account from OB customer profile.</tag0:summary>

  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109683</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-01-20T08:14:48.713Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Update Transaction History For Loan Accounts</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirement: When a loan account is newly associated with an online banking profile (via BET) up to 18 months of available transaction history will be shown the next business day.

The header date at the top of the trigger file to BaNCS is the date plus 24 hours since the last time an update from BaNCS was received. This will trigger BaNCS to send back all transactions from the last time an update was provided.

For newly associated accounts Online Banking will send a specified date next to the account number in the trigger file. This date indicates whether to do a "first-time" extract. The batch process will for these "first time" accounts extract the transactions based on this specified date and will pull history from current date back to and including  transactions occurring on the specified date.

When no date is provided next to the account,  BaNCS will return only transactions posted in the current cycle, determined from the header date in the file.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109683" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109683" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109676</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-01-20T08:17:21.742Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Trigger File</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Trigger File - Online Banking batch process sends an Account List trigger file (finder file) of ALL loan accounts in online banking to the BaNCS loan system

Requirement: Online Banking triggers the batch extraction process by sending an Account List trigger file (finder file) of all loan accounts in online banking to the BaNCS loan system. The trigger file is a simple list of account numbers.

There is a header date at the top of the trigger file, it is the date plus 24 hours since the last time an update was received from BaNCS. This will trigger BaNCS to send back all transactions from the last time an update was provided.

If a trigger file is sent without this header date the process will fail.

Note: For newly associated accounts a date is provided next to the account to indicate how much past transaction history is required. If the individual account has a specified date BaNCS will send back all transactions back to that specified date for that one account.

For details please reference the linked BaNCS OB Trigger File Interface Specification: IOF-223-OLBK-01-B05 CL Interface</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109676" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109676" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-01-27T00:04:57.657Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Commercial Loan View Exceptions</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">BaNCS Channel Access Priority flag defines view privileges and exceptions are not allowed.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">View Commercial Loan Statements</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Customers can view their loan statement history from most recent statement back to Jan 2016 under eDocuments.

The Commercial Loan Statement form name CL173 (SHAW Statements)  prior to Release 2 and post Release 2 CL011 (BaNCS statements)

Online and mobile banking will need to be able to access both forms, potentially on the same Loan.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">CL Payment Loan Balance Real Time</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">When a payment made via Online Banking is made real time, the loan current and available balances are updated and shown via Online Banking.

Requirement: Once a payment clears processing the loan current and available balance will be adjusted with the payment credit amount.

Payments may clear real-time or anytime through-out the day. Online banking will update the balances at customer login and following a transaction on the loan account. The current balance (not available balance) is also updated during the nightly batch process.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-01-31T21:55:49.023Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Extract Files - ibalpost</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Balances (ibalpost) – Loan Detail Record (Type 1)  Record type '1' signals that the key was found and that the requested data is extracted.

Requirement: The return information is provided in an Extract Files (one set per bank). The content is provided in three extract files and varies based on type (Type 1; Type 2; Type 9).

Type 1: Provides balance information and indicates that the key was found in the loan system and the requested details have been extracted.

Type 2: Provides Transaction details and indicates that the history information has been accumulated into the file form the loans system. The period of history returned, depends on the date in the trigger file. The transaction description field in the Type 2 record is a combined field so it has a length of 60 (increased from 25 in other account type descriptions)

Type 6: Indicates that the loan is to be excluded from Online Banking for some reason.

For Type 6 Online Banking will remove the association of the account to the customer so customer access via Online Banking will be denied regardless of the Channel Access Priority Flag setting. Once disassociated these accounts will not be sent to BaNCS in the trigger file. This also applies to Consumer Loans.

Note: Type 9 is used by other types of accounts e.g. DDA to identify closed accounts but for BaNCS loan accounts Type 9 is not used as closed accounts are identified by the Channel Access flags.

For details please reference linked BaNCS OB Batch Extract File Interface Specification: IOF-223-OLBK-01-B06 CL Interface</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109678" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:title type="text">CL Extract Files - Status File Not Found</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Status File  Not Found (Type 6) The '6' Record is used to signal that the requested record was not found.  These accounts will be  excluded for future enquiry and will not be sent to BaNCS in future.

Requirements: The return information is provided in an Extract Files (one set per bank). The content is provided in three extract files and varies based on type (Type 1; Type 2; Type 9).

Type 2: Provides Transaction details and indicates that the history information has been accumulated into the file form the loans system. The period of history returned, depends on the date in the trigger file. The transaction description field in the Type 2 record is a combined field so it has a length of 60 (increased from 25 in other account type descriptions)

Type 6: Indicates that the loan is to be excluded from Online Banking for some reason.

For Type 6 Online Banking will remove the association of the account to the customer so customer access via Online Banking will be denied regardless of the Channel Access Priority Flag setting. Once disassociated these accounts will not be sent to BaNCS in the trigger file. This also applies to Consumer Loans.

Note: Type 9 is used by other types of accounts e.g. DDA to identify closed accounts but for BaNCS loan accounts Type 9 is not used as closed accounts are identified by the Channel Access flags.

For details please reference linked BaNCS OB Batch Extract File Interface Specification: IOF-223-OLBK-01-B06 CL Interface</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">CL Extract Files - Excluded Type 9</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Excluded (Type 9)  Record type '9' indicates that the loan is closed or excluded from Online Banking for other reasons.  The association of the account to the customer will be removed so customer access will be denied regardless of Channel Access Priority Flag setting.

Type 6: Indicates that the loan is to be excluded from Online Banking for some reason.

For Type 6 Online Banking will remove the association of the account to the customer so customer access via Online Banking will be denied regardless of the Channel Access Priority Flag setting. Once disassociated these accounts will not be sent to BaNCS in the trigger file. This also applies to Consumer Loans.

Note: Type 9 is used by other types of accounts e.g. DDA to identify closed accounts but for BaNCS loan accounts Type 9 is not used as closed accounts are identified by the Channel Access flags.

For details please reference linked BaNCS OB Batch Extract File Interface Specification: IOF-223-OLBK-01-B06 CL Interface</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">CL Extract Files - tranpost</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Transactions (tranpost) – History (Type 2)  Record type '2' signals that the data will be history data from the commercial loans accumulated transaction file.  The trigger (finder)  file indicates whether to do a "first-time" extract based on date in trigger file (to pull history back to specified date) or  just transactions posted in the current cycle (no date provided in trigger file). 

Requirements: The return information is provided in an Extract Files (one set per bank). The content is provided in three extract files and varies based on type (Type 1; Type 2; Type 9).

Type 1: Provides balance information and indicates that the key was found in the loan system and the requested details have been extracted.

Type 2: Provides Transaction details and indicates that the history information has been accumulated into the file form the loans system. The period of history returned, depends on the date in the trigger file. The transaction description field in the Type 2 record is a combined field so it has a length of 60 (increased from 25 in other account type descriptions)

Type 6: Indicates that the loan is to be excluded from Online Banking for some reason.

For Type 6 Online Banking will remove the association of the account to the customer so customer access via Online Banking will be denied regardless of the Channel Access Priority Flag setting. Once disassociated these accounts will not be sent to BaNCS in the trigger file. This also applies to Consumer Loans.

Note: Type 9 is used by other types of accounts e.g. DDA to identify closed accounts but for BaNCS loan accounts Type 9 is not used as closed accounts are identified by the Channel Access flags.

For details please reference linked BaNCS OB Batch Extract File Interface Specification: IOF-223-OLBK-01-B06 CL Interface</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109685" title="" type="application/xml"/>

  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109684</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-01-31T21:59:26.090Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Extract Files - Returned from BaNCS</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Extract file returned from BANCS

Requirement: The return information is provided in an Extract Files (one set per bank). The content is provided in three extract files and varies based on type (Type 1; Type 2; Type 9).

Type 1: Provides balance information and indicates that the key was found in the loan system and the requested details have been extracted.

Type 2: Provides Transaction details and indicates that the history information has been accumulated into the file form the loans system. The period of history returned, depends on the date in the trigger file. The transaction description field in the Type 2 record is a combined field so it has a length of 60 (increased from 25 in other account type descriptions)

Type 6: Indicates that the loan is to be excluded from Online Banking for some reason.

For Type 6 Online Banking will remove the association of the account to the customer so customer access via Online Banking will be denied regardless of the Channel Access Priority Flag setting. Once disassociated these accounts will not be sent to BaNCS in the trigger file. This also applies to Consumer Loans.

Note: Type 9 is used by other types of accounts e.g. DDA to identify closed accounts but for BaNCS loan accounts Type 9 is not used as closed accounts are identified by the Channel Access flags.

For details please reference linked BaNCS OB Batch Extract File Interface Specification: IOF-223-OLBK-01-B06 CL Interface</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109684" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:title type="text">Commercial Loan Payment Pending Transfer</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">If the payment passed validation and is not cleared real-time the payment transaction will show in the 'Scheduled' and 'All Transfers' tabs on the Transfers Page.

Note: BaNCS system is a real-time system however only during business day's in Release 2</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T20:49:01.491Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Payment Pending Transfer Data Elements</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">When a transfer is pending, the following information shall be shown on the transfers page.

Data elements displayed: Delivery date; Confirmation number; From Account; To Account; Status In Progress Type "Single"; Frequency "One Time Only"; Amount</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T20:49:39.347Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Payment does not show pending post</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Even though the payment passes validation the payment transaction will NOT show under PENDING on the loan account activity on submission of the payment. (Loans do not show intraday memo posts)</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T20:50:05.127Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Payment Cleared Transfer - Real Time</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Once the Payment clears real-time processing the payment transaction will show on the 'Completed' and  the  'All Transfers' tabs on the Transfers Page. It will no longer show in the Scheduled tab.

The transaction will clear processing real-time if on a business day, or during night batch processing if on a non-business day.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">CL Payment Cleared Transfer - Batch</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Once the Payment clears real-time processing the payment transaction will show on the 'Completed' and  the  'All Transfers' tabs on the Transfers Page. It will no longer show in the Scheduled tab.

The transaction will clear processing real-time if on a business day, or during night batch processing if on a non-business day.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T20:50:50.583Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Payment Cleared Transaction</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Once the payment clears processing and after batch processing (RT or next business day) the payment transaction will show on the loan account activity register under CLEARED.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T20:51:08.832Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Balance Updated Upon OB Login</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">When a payment is made to a commercial loan via another method, such as BaNCS, Zeus/Teller, etc, the balance is updated upon Online Banking login.

Requirement: Once a payment clears processing the loan current and available balance will be adjusted with the payment credit amount.

Payments may clear real-time or anytime through-out the day. Online banking will update the balances at customer login; following a transaction on the loan account; and during the nightly batch process.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109588" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T20:51:28.205Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Payment Debit Available Balance</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">If the payment to a commercial loan passes validation the debit account available balance will be adjusted with the payment debit amount at the time of the payment setup.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109589" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T20:52:02.717Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Payment Debit Current Balance - Real Time</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">When a commercial loan payment is made, the transfer from account current balances will be updated to reflect the debit amount.

Requirement: Once the payment clears processing the debit account current balance will be adjusted with the payment debit amount.

Payments may clear real-time or anytime through-out the day. Online banking will update the balances at customer login; following a transaction on the loan account; and during the nightly batch process.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109590" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T20:53:44.323Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Payment Debit Current Balance - Batch</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">When a commercial loan payment is made as a scheduled payment or after hours, the transfer from account current balances will be updated to reflect the debit amount after the batch job has been run.

Requirement: Once the payment clears processing the debit account current balance will be adjusted with the payment debit amount.

Payments may clear real-time or anytime through-out the day. Online banking will update the balances at customer login; following a transaction on the loan account; and during the nightly batch process.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109591" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T20:54:16.697Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Payment Debit Pending</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">After a successful commercial loan payment, the debit account shall show a debit transaction on the account activity page via Online Banking.  This may also be seen on the MLFI screen.

Requirement: If the payment passes validation, the payment debit transaction will show under PENDING on the debit account activity on completion of the payment.

Displayed Date Elements: Date; Transaction "Transfer &confnumber"; Description; Status 'IN Progress'; Amount</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">CL Payment Debit Pending Data Elements</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">After a commercial loan payment, the debit account shall show the following data on the account transaction page:
   Date;
   Transaction "Transfer &confnumber"; 
    Description; 
    Status 'IN Progress'; 
    Amount


Requirements: If the payment passes validation, the payment debit transaction will show under PENDING on the debit account activity on completion of the payment.

Displayed Date Elements: Date; Transaction "Transfer &confnumber"; Description; Status 'IN Progress'; Amount</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T20:55:24.563Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Payment Debit Cleared</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">A payment to a commercial loan, once processed will show as a cleared transaction in the from account after the daily batch job is uploaded.  The transaction will show in the account activity page, with the following data:
Delivery date; 
Transaction "Credit"; 
Description, Status 'Cleared'; 
Amount

Requirement: Once the payment clears processing and after batch processing (next business day) the payment debit transaction will show on the debit account activity under CLEARED.

Displayed Date Elements: Delivery date; Transaction "Credit"; Description, Status 'Cleared'; Amount</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109594" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T20:55:45.200Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Payment Fail Error Message</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">If a payment to a commercial loan fails, the Online Banking user shall be shown an error message.

Requirement: On failure to validate payment, a message is shown to notify the customer of the failure.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T20:56:12.398Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Payment Fail External - Quick Transfer</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Transfers from an external account to a commercial loan via the quick transfers section are shown the error message below.

Requirements: Payments are not allowed to be made from external accounts.

Customer Failed Message Text: "Warning: This type of transfer is not permitted and was not processed. If you need additional information please contact Customer Service.""</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T20:56:41.501Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Payment Fail External - Create Transfer</tag0:title>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T21:09:51.156Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Transaction Processing Times - Real Time</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">OB will process Commercial Loan Transactions in real-time on business days, between the hours of  9 PM MPT every day for Amegy and around 10 PM MPT and starts again right after 12 AM the next business day

Requirement: Online Banking, via BaNCS, will process Commercial Loan Transactions real-time on business days. 

For non-business days, when DEPOSITS does not post, the posting is delayed for BaNCS until the next business day to ensure the credits and debits post together. This is due to the Reg E requirement that requires credits and debits must be posted on the same day for the same transaction. This is managed by Transaction Gateway which will ‘memo post’ for BaNCS on days when DEPOSITS do not process.

Real-time posting cut-off is around 9 PM MPT every day for Amegy and around 10 PM MPT for other affiliates on business days, and starts again right after 12 AM the next business day. After 10 PM (or 9 PM for Amegy) on business days and during weekends/holidays, the transaction is not real-time posted in BaNCS. Those late day transactions are held in the Transaction Gateway and processed through MICR via batch the next-day.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T21:11:54.290Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Advance Validate Signers - Not Allowed</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Online Banking shall not allow an advance from a commercial loan if the TO account does not have the same signers on the commercial loan.

Requirements: For Advances, the signers on the loan account and the destination account are validated to make sure there is one or more signers on both and that the relationship on the destination account is valid.

Note this rule can override the relationship rule that a guarantor can not make an advance when Multi-Party Agreements are in place.

For example:

Company A is what the customer logs in under, and Company A is a GUARANTOR to CLA1 and BORROWER on CLA2.  Company A is PRIN OWNER on DDA1, and IBUSER on DDA2.

Company B has its accounts linked to Company A via IBUSER/IBVIEW, and is BORROWER on CLA1.  Company B is PRIN OWNER on DDA2.

Expected results:

Logging in under Company A, a user (with proper entitlements):

Should be able to Transfer from DDA1 to CLA1.
Should be able to Transfer from DDA1 to CLA2.
Should be able to Transfer from DDA2 to CLA1.
Should be able to Transfer from DDA2 to CLA2.
Should NOT be able to Transfer from CLA1 to DDA1.
Should be able to Transfer from CLA1 to DDA2.
Should NOT be able to Transfer from CLA2 to DDA2.
Should be able to Transfer from CLA2 to DDA1.
So even though the company being logged in under is Guarantor to CLA1, a user under that profile can Advance from CLA1 to DDA2 because the signer rule shows that the ownership matches between those two accounts.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirement: Once the Advance clears processing and after nightly batch processing has completed the Advance transaction will show on the loan account activity under CLEARED.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109612" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109613</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T21:19:52.925Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Advance Loan Balance</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirement: Once the Advance clears processing the loan current and available balance will be adjusted with the Advance debit amount.

Transactions may clear real-time or anytime through-out the day. Online banking will update the balances at customer login and following a transaction on the loan account. The current balance (not the available balance) is also updated during the nightly batch process.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109613" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109613" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109614</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T21:20:13.820Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Advance Available Balance</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirement: If the Advance passes validation the credit account available balance will be adjusted with the Advance credit amount.

The available balance is shown on the pull down when performing a transfer.

Online banking will update the available balance at customer login and following a transaction on the account.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109614" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109614" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109615</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T21:20:32.935Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Advance Current Balance</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirement: Once the Advance clears processing the credit account current balance will be adjusted with the Advance credit amount.

Transactions may clear real-time or anytime through-out the day. Online banking will update the current balances at customer login, following a transaction on the account and during the nightly batch process.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109615" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109615" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109616</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T21:20:47.361Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Advance Credit Pending</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirement: If the Advance passes validation the Advance credit transaction will show under PENDING on the credit account activity on completion of the Advance.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109616" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109616" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109617</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T21:21:05.267Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Advance Credit Cleared</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirements: Once the Advance clears processing AND after nightly batch has completed the Advance credit transaction will show on the credit account activity register under CLEARED.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109617" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109617" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109618</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T21:41:18.200Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Advance Initiated Notification</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirement: Immediately when an advance from a loan is initiated and completed in real-time, an alert email is sent to the customers primary email address.

Here is Zions example of the content:

“You are receiving this email as notification that either an advance, transfer to a friend or wire transfer was initiated from your account ending in 1504 within your Zions Bank Business Online Banking profile on 01/22/2018. If you did not initiate this request or have any questions, please contact Online Banking Support at 800-840-4999 Monday through Saturday, 7 AM to 8 PM, MT.”</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109618" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109618" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109619</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T21:41:43.676Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Scheduled Payment Notifications - Failure</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Online Banking shall send an email notification upon a failed scheduled payment to a commercial loan.

Requirement: Customers will receive success and failed transfer notifications (email or online) for any scheduled payments if they have set up "Successful Transfer" or "Failed/Disallowed Transfer" alerts in Online Banking.

Note:  These alerts only apply to scheduled, not immediate, transfers, and kick off when the scheduled transfer batch process runs each morning.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109619" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109619" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109620</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T21:55:01.847Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Advance to DDA Only</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirement: The destination account for an advance from a loan must be a DDA account. The customer is only given the option of selecting a DDA account.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109620" title="" type="application/xml"/>

  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109621</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T21:55:43.238Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Advance Relationship</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirements: Advances are only allowed to be made if the customer has an appropriate relationship to the receipt account and the loan account.

Loan accounts can not be selected for a Transfer from if the relationship type is Guarantor (unless the signers/IBUSER override is in place - reference requirement 554881 Advance Validate Signers)</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109621" title="" type="application/xml"/>

  </tag0:entry>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T21:55:59.817Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Advance Minimum Limit -  Vectra</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirements: Vectra enforce a minimum limit for Advances ($ amount TBD)

BaNCS will validate minimum amounts for Advances. If customer advance is less than the minimum amount the customer will receive an appropriate error message (TBD)  immediately after submitting the advance.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">CL Advance Minimum Limit - Amegy</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirements: Amegy enforce a minimum limit for Advances ($ amount TBD)

BaNCS will validate minimum amounts for Advances. If customer advance is less than the minimum amount the customer will receive an appropriate error message (TBD)  immediately after submitting the advance.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">CL Scheduled Payment Cleared Transaction</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirement: Once the payment clears processing (during night processing of the scheduled day) the payment transaction will show on the loan account activity under CLEARED.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109624" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T21:57:07.782Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Schedule Payment To</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirement: For Commercial Loans sourced by BaNCS the customer can select a loan account for payment transfer provided they have the appropriate access rights to the loan.

Payment transfer rights are defined by Channel Access flags - reference linked requirement "BaNCS Commercial Loan Product Access Rights"</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109625" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T21:57:33.790Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Scheduled Payment Cleared Transfer</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirement: Once the payment clears processing (during night processing of the scheduled day) the payment transaction will show in the Completed and 'All Transfers' tabs on the Transfers Page. It will no longer show in the Scheduled tab.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T21:57:57.233Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Setting up schedule payment fail</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirement: If the setting up of the schedule payment fails validation the user will receive a real-time meaningful message on the transfer screen as to why the payment could not be scheduled.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109627" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T21:58:18.132Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Scheduled Payment Loan Balance</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirement: Once the payment clears processing (during night processing of the scheduled day) the loan current and available balance will be adjusted with the payment credit amount.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109628" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T21:58:55.000Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Scheduled Payment Current Balance</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirements: Once the payment clears processing (during night processing of the scheduled day) the debit account current balance will be adjusted with the payment debit amount.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109629" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:title type="text">CL Scheduled Payment Transfer</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirement: If the scheduled payment passed validation the payment transaction will show in the Scheduled and 'All Transfers' tabs on the Transfers Page.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:08:00.770Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Scheduled Principle Only Payments - Not Allowed</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Online Banking will show an error if a scheduled principle only payment to a commercial loan is not allowed from BaNCS.

Requirements: Online Banking will allow a customer to schedule Principal Only payments for all Commercial Loans source from BaNCS and will rely on BaNCS to determine if this is a valid payment. If Principal Only payments are not allowed transaction will fail.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109633" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:title type="text">CL Scheduled Principle Only Payment - Allowed</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Online Banking will allow a scheduled principle only payment to a commercial loan if allowed from BaNCS.

Requirements: Online Banking will allow a customer to schedule Principal Only payments for all Commercial Loans source from BaNCS and will rely on BaNCS to determine if this is a valid payment. If Principal Only payments are not allowed transaction will fail.</tag0:summary>

All other loans access rights are based on Channel Access Priority Flag</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">CL Loan Product Code/Type Identification</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirements: 
BaNCS Product types are identified by an eight digit identifier (Product/sub-product code). Online banking distinguished between products with a three character prefix to the product identifier e.g. DDA, SAV for Commercial Loans the eight digit number is prefixed with 'CLB'</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109672" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:35:03.314Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Customer Messages</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Customer messages are very important to the online and mobile customer experience so all return transaction event messages and error code messages need to be applicable to the customers experience or translated to applicable terms.

Meaning full messages are provided to customer when a submitted transaction is not accepted by the BaNCS loan system.

Error message details TBD

Messaging is provided back to the requesting application as to the determination of the request.

Approved requests return a transaction successful message
Declined requests should return specific codes with the reason for the decline:
http://onecorp.zbc.internal/sites/archive01/23875/Workstreams/Sprints/Requirements%20Documents/Transfers/Transfer%20Rules%20and%20Validation/TransferErrorCodeMapping.xls</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109673" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109673" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:35:24.932Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL BaNCS Service Not Available</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">When the BaNCS system is not available, e.g. it is in maintenance, any submitted transaction to BaNCS from Online Banking will result in a system not available message.

An IBADMIN flag, set by Operations staff, indicates if the BaNCS system is down for maintenance. When this flag is set Customers will see a service is not available message if they attempt to submit a Commercial Loan transaction.

Customers will be presented the following message on the consumer loan Account Register page:

“! We are currently performing scheduled maintenance. Transfers to and from loans, loan transaction history and loan payoff quotes are not available. Please try these features again later.”</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109674" title="" type="application/xml"/>

  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109675</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:35:42.180Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Transaction Processing Times</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Online Banking, via BaNCS, will process Commercial Loan Transactions real-time on business days. 

For non-business days, when DEPOSITS does not post, the posting is delayed for BaNCS until the next business day to ensure the credits and debits post together. This is due to the Reg E requirement that requires credits and debits must be posted on the same day for the same transaction. This is managed by Transaction Gateway which will ‘memo post’ for BaNCS on days when DEPOSITS do not process.

Real-time posting cut-off is around 9 PM MPT every day for Amegy and around 10 PM MPT for other affiliates on business days, and starts again right after 12 AM the next business day. After 10 PM (or 9 PM for Amegy) on business days and during weekends/holidays, the transaction is not real-time posted in BaNCS. Those late day transactions are held in the Transaction Gateway and processed through MICR via batch the next-day.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109675" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:36:41.068Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL BaNCS Channel Access Updates - Extract File</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Extract File – Extract file returned from BANCS

Requirement: The BaNCS batch process updates the loan account transaction rights based on the Channel Access flags in the type 1 loan detail record:

Data Element	Description	Batch/OB Action
ChannelAcess	Product level flag 	Stored in OB and updated by batch and web-services  but not used at this time
ChannelAcessApply	Further restricted level flag based on loan lifecycle, current financial standing	Stored in OB and updated by batch and web-services  and is used to define account level access and transact rules for OB</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109677" title="" type="application/xml"/>

  </tag0:entry>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:37:24.234Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Event Based Alerts</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">As the batch process updates daily customers will receive event based alerts even if the customer does not login to online banking that day.

Alert Types:

Balance Over Limit
Balance Under Limit
Periodic Balance
Failed/Disallowed Transfer
Transaction not approved by send date
Successful Transfer</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109686" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:37:40.197Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Advance Minimum Limit</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">When an advance from a commercial loan is requested via Online Banking, any minimum amount limit shall be controlled via BaNCS.

Requirement: Online Banking will no longer do the minimum advance validation upfront (currently only used for Amegy and Vectra). In future minimum amount controls will be performed by the BaNCS system, which will fail the transaction if below the minimum amount and return an appropriate error message.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109809" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109809" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>

  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109810</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:38:04.773Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Deprecate Customer Records Control</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Loans with an account number ending with 0000 shall eligible for Online Banking.

Requirements: For historical reasons Loan numbers appearing in RCIF that end in 0000 are excluded from Online Banking, this was because the 0000 use to indicate that the record in RCIF was a customer record. However, today the RCIF CL customer records are identified by a different RCIF Product Code CLCUST . Online Banking retrieves commercial loans based on the RCIF Product Code CLLOAN therefore the customer records with RCIF product code CLCUST are never accessed by Online Banking. 

As a result, the Online Banking code for excluding 0000 records is no longer required.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109810" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109810" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109811</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:38:28.103Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Deprecate Major Commitments Control</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Online Banking shall allow commercial loans that end with 99 to be eligible for all access if allowed via BaNCS.

Requirement: Commercial lending products, other than ATL s and RLoC s will not be made available to online banking customers. IGF s (guidance facilities) and Major Commitments must be excluded from being added to the Internet Banking system. These loans are identified by the last two digits of the loan number being 99 . 

As new loan created in BaNCS uses a different structure a new method is required to exclude these loans. 

Online Banking and Mobile Banking will no longer apply this rule because Major Commitments will be managed differently in BaNCS. They will not be stored as a Loans, hence will not be accessed by Online Banking and Mobile Banking.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109811" title="" type="application/xml"/>

  </tag0:entry>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:38:48.651Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Deprecate Zions Bank ID Access Controls</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Zions has additional controls based on Bank ID. These become redundant with BaNCS as the logic is replaced with the Channel Access Priority Flags.

Controls to be removed:

001 Show in IB

002 Do not show because will not use in the future (4 existing loans will be closed)

003 Show in IB

004 Do not show since not used

006 Do not show since not used

008 Do not show since FAMC-serviced loans, not Bank assets

163 Show in IB</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:39:03.432Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Access for Zions POLB</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Zions POLB customers who have an eligible commercial loan may view their loan online.

Requirement: Zions and NSB personal customers are able to access their Commercial Loans.

In support of standardization, remove the restriction in Online and Mobile Banking that does not allow, for Zions and NSB, Commercial Loans to be accessed by Online personal customers.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:39:19.363Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Access for NSB POLB</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">NSB POLB customers who have an eligible commercial loan may view the loan online.

Requirement: Zions and NSB personal customers are able to access their Commercial Loans.

In support of standardization, remove the restriction in Online and Mobile Banking that does not allow, for Zions and NSB, Commercial Loans to be accessed by Online personal customers.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109814" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109814" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109861</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:39:51.269Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Product Code/Type Classification Change</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirement: Online banking will define new loan types to match BaNCS product classification.

Product identification will change for the BaNCS loan products. The length of the identifier will increase from 6 digits to 11 digits. (Not viewable to customer).

The product code will be the letters ‘CLB’ concatenated with the BaNCS eight-digit product identifier.

The products will be defined in Online banking as they are today for SHAW loans but the products are being simplified into 10-12 loan product code/types (as opposed to 100+) so a migration process will occur at release time.

Today, overtime the Online banking product type will change for an account based on the payment cycles, i.e. when the loan term type changes from non-revolving to revolving.  For BaNCS, the new simplified product types will not change product type based on payment lifecycle so they are much more static. For display purposes, however some of these static product types are considered revolving or non-revolving and will always be displayed accordingly. See diagram on original requirement.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109861" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109861" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109870</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:40:21.300Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Account Number Length Increase - Existing</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Online Banking shall verify that existing commercial loan account numbers shall be converted correctly and shall be viewable online.

Requirements: The BaNCS Commercial loan account number structures for new loans will be structured slightly differently than existing SHAW account numbers. The account number lengths will change. Therefore, Online and Mobile Banking will need to handle the old and new account number structures and will need to do a data migration of account numbers for loans migrated to BaNCS.

Commercial loan account number structures will change.

BaNCS account numbers can be up to 16 characters.

Loans from CLCS have account numbers of 15 characters.

The structure of BaNCS account number will vary slightly between existing SHAW loans and new loans created in BaNCS.

Online Banking Data migration is required for all loans that are migrated to BaNCS on release because the RCIF account numbers will be changed (from 14 to 15 digits with a leading zero) for any loans migrated to BaNCS on release day.

For newly created loans Online Banking and Mobile Banking will need to be able to support 16-character account numbers. (Assumption: No development required as this is already supported for Card Accounts).</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109870" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:40:42.841Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Account Number Length Increase - New</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Online Banking shall verify that new commercial loan account numbers shall be viewable online.

Requirements: The BaNCS Commercial loan account number structures for new loans will be structured slightly differently than existing SHAW account numbers. The account number lengths will change. Therefore, Online and Mobile Banking will need to handle the old and new account number structures and will need to do a data migration of account numbers for loans migrated to BaNCS.

Commercial loan account number structures will change.

BaNCS account numbers can be up to 16 characters.

Loans from CLCS have account numbers of 15 characters.

The structure of BaNCS account number will vary slightly between existing SHAW loans and new loans created in BaNCS.

Online Banking Data migration is required for all loans that are migrated to BaNCS on release because the RCIF account numbers will be changed (from 14 to 15 digits with a leading zero) for any loans migrated to BaNCS on release day.

For newly created loans Online Banking and Mobile Banking will need to be able to support 16-character account numbers. (Assumption: No development required as this is already supported for Card Accounts).</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:41:13.452Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Apply New Product Codes To Commercial Loans</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Online Banking shall verify that commercial loans shall be visible, if allowed, when converted to a new product code.

Requirements: Online Banking Data migration process will update Product Code/Type for all loans that are migrated to BaNCS on release because the Product/Code Types are being simplified.

BaNCS will provide a Old/New file of accounts moving from SHAW to BaNCS with the Product Category and Sub-Category on release day.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:41:36.437Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Scheduled Payment Notifications - Success</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Online Banking shall send an email notification upon a successfully scheduled payment to a commercial loan.

Requirement: Customers will receive success and failed transfer notifications (email or online) for any scheduled payments if they have set up "Successful Transfer" or "Failed/Disallowed Transfer" alerts in Online Banking.

Note:  These alerts only apply to scheduled, not immediate, transfers, and kick off when the scheduled transfer batch process runs each morning.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109876" title="" type="application/xml"/>

  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109957</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:41:58.132Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Payment Loan Balance Batch</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">When a payment made via Online Banking is made via batch, the loan current and available balances are updated and shown via Online Banking.

Requirement: Once a payment clears processing the loan current and available balance will be adjusted with the payment credit amount.

Payments may clear real-time or anytime through-out the day. Online banking will update the balances at customer login and following a transaction on the loan account. The current balance (not available balance) is also updated during the nightly batch process.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109957" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:42:30.502Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Principle Only Payments</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirements: Online Banking will allow a customer to make Principal Only payments for all Commercial Loans source from BaNCS and will rely on BaNCS to determine if this is a valid payment. If Principal Only payments are not allowed an appropriate error message will be returned.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:42:50.768Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL BaNCS Service Not Available</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Requirement: When the BaNCS system is not available, e.g. it is in maintenance, any submitted transaction to BaNCS from Online Banking will result in a system not available message.

An IBADMIN flag, set by Operations staff, indicates if the BaNCS system is down for maintenance. When this flag is set Customers will see a service is not available message if they attempt to submit a Commercial Loan transaction.

Customers will be presented the following message on the consumer loan Account Register page:

“! We are currently performing scheduled maintenance. Transfers to and from loans, loan transaction history and loan payoff quotes are not available. Please try these features again later.”</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109959" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:43:29.113Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Purged Commercial Loans Are Not Visible Online</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">When a commercial loan is purged via the batch job, the commercial loan shall not be visible online.

Requirements: Commercial Loan accounts that have a status of closed are not to be accessible in Online Banking. The status information is provided in the Type 1 extract file:

Data Element	Description	Batch/OB Action
Account Status	Current status of account	Stored in OB and updated by batch and web-services . If closed batch and web-services will disassociate account from OB customer profile.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:44:09.518Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Retail Loans - Closed Account Not Shown Online</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Closed retail loan accounts shall not be visible via Online Banking.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109961" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-01T22:44:47.131Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Purged Retail Loans Are Not Visible Online</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">When a retail loan is purged via the batch job, it shall not be visible online.

Requirement: The return information is provided in an Extract Files (one set per bank). The content is provided in three extract files and varies based on type (Type 1; Type 2; Type 9).

Type 1: Provides balance information and indicates that the key was found in the loan system and the requested details have been extracted.

Type 2: Provides Transaction details and indicates that the history information has been accumulated into the file form the loans system. The period of history returned, depends on the date in the trigger file. The transaction description field in the Type 2 record is a combined field so it has a length of 60 (increased from 25 in other account type descriptions)

Type 6: Indicates that the loan is to be excluded from Online Banking for some reason.

For Type 6 Online Banking will remove the association of the account to the customer so customer access via Online Banking will be denied regardless of the Channel Access Priority Flag setting. Once disassociated these accounts will not be sent to BaNCS in the trigger file. This also applies to Consumer Loans.

Note: Type 9 is used by other types of accounts e.g. DDA to identify closed accounts but for BaNCS loan accounts Type 9 is not used as closed accounts are identified by the Channel Access flags.

For details please reference linked BaNCS OB Batch Extract File Interface Specification: IOF-223-OLBK-01-B06 CL Interface</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2018-02-08T21:25:31.884Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Batch - Scheduled Internal Xfer</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">The ACCTRXFREXEC batch job will process scheduled internal transfers.

 Valid transfers will memopost on the host with the correct date and time
      Valid transfers:
      PAYMENTS TO CL
      PAYMENTS TO CC
      PAYMENTS TO ACLS
      TRANSFER TO PROFILE ACCOUNT
      TRANSFER TO FRIEND ACCOUNT

     Valid recurring transfer will also generate the next occurrence


 Invalid transfer will not memo-post on the host.  In the UI they will move to the completed tab with a status of Problem.
      Invalid for:
      NSF
      OVER LIMIT
      CLOSE TO POST
      Invalid recurring transfer will also generated the next occurrence

 If next occurrence if going to be over-limit, that next occurrence is still generated</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Batch_-_Scheduled_Internal_Xfer" title="" type="application/xml"/>
