    <tag0:updated>2018-02-08T21:55:41.631Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Batch OD but not NSF</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">The external transfer memo-post job will process an otherwise valid outbound external transfer where the amount is more than the available, but less than the authorized.  The transfer will update to an In Progress status and the transaction will display in the MLFI screen</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Batch_OD_but_not_NSF" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=50055" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Payment_daily_limits</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-08T22:20:52.118Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Payment daily limits</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">A customer will not be able to add a payment that is over the daily limits in the UI.

 The SBBKACHEXEC batch job will not process a payment that is over the daily limit.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Payment_daily_limits" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=49988" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Payment_transaction_limits</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-08T22:43:00.853Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Payment transaction limits</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">A customer will not be allowed to add a payment that is over their the transaction limit from the UI.

 The SBBKACHEXEC batch job will not process a payment that is over their transaction limit.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Payment_transaction_limits" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=49987" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Recurring_payments</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-08T23:15:09.550Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Recurring payments</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">The customer will be able to add and maintain recurring payments.

 When a payment is processed by the SBBKACHEXEC batch job, the next occurrence is generated

 The next occurrence is generated when the processed payment is valid or invalid (fails for limit, etc.).</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Recurring_payments" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=49969" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Payments_Center</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-08T23:28:13.882Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Payments Center</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">A customer will be able to delete and maintain payments from the Payment Center</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Payments_Center" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=50080" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Batch_Memo-Post</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-13T18:25:10.668Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Batch Memo-Post</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">External transfers are memo-posted via a batch process.

 The memo-post process will process external transfers with a status of scheduled (status = 2).  It will process inbound and outbound external transfers

 The external transfer will pass or fail the memo-post process.  If the transfer passes, the status is updated to In Progress (status = 6).  If the transfer fails for NSF, the status is updated to Problem (status = 9).  If the transfer fails for other than NSF, the status is updated to Problem (status = 8).

 If a problem transfer is recurring, the next occurrence is generated.

 If the transfer passes, the credit/debit will be displayed in the MLFI screen with the correct date and time.

 When the problem transfer fails, a transfer failure email is generated and sent to the customer.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Batch_Memo-Post" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=50054" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Batch_Process_ACH</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-13T20:55:03.657Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Batch Process ACH</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">An ACH batch process generates an ACH file of inbound and outbound external transfers.

 It will process inbound external transfers with a status of 2 or 6

 It will process outbound external transfers with a status of 6

 If any of these are recurring, it will generate the next occurrence of the transfer.

 If the transfer being processed is Inbound, the credit will be stripped and replaced with a credit to a GL.  

 The batch process will append the inbound credits previously stripped, along with a debit to the GL previously credited.

 The batch process will include fee records for ABT and CBT</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Batch_Process_ACH" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=50049" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/SBBKACHEXEC_batch_job</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-13T22:58:38.755Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">SBBKACHEXEC batch job</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">The business payments ACH file is generated by the SBBKACHEXEC batch job.

 The ACH file will include the credits and debits for tax payments and direct deposit payments that have a send date <= today's date and an effective date => today's date.

 The ACH file will include prenote recipient records that have not been included in a previous ACH file.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/SBBKACHEXEC_batch_job" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=49976" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/SBBKPNOTEXEC_batch_job</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-13T23:48:49.165Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">SBBKPNOTEXEC batch job</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">The SBBKPNOTEXEC batch job will process pre-note recipients, where the recipient is marked for pre-note on a template but does not have a prenote expiry date.  

 In the UI, the recipient will show as pre-noted and will have the expire date.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/SBBKPNOTEXEC_batch_job" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=49975" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109963</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-14T00:07:49.674Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Retail Loan Payoff - Current Day</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">A retail loan shown via Online Banking shall allow the customer to view a payoff for the current day</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109963" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109963" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109965</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-14T00:07:49.748Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Retail Loan Payoff - Future Dated > 30 Days</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">A retail loan customer may not request a payoff with a date in the future further than 30 days.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109965" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109965" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109964</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-14T00:11:49.834Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Retail Loan Payoff - Future Dated <= 30 Days</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">A Retail Loan shall allow an Online Banking user to request a future dated payoff if the payoff date is 30 days or less into the future.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:109964" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=109964" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Templates</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-14T00:27:50.317Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Templates</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">A customer will be able to add, delete and maintain templates, to include initiating a payment from a template</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Templates" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=49990" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Batch_Over_Daily_Limit</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-14T18:45:25.722Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Batch Over Daily Limit</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">If an external transfer, when added to other external transfer for a certain day, will sum to more than the customer's daily limit for that type of transfer, the memopost batch job will not memopost the transfer to the host.  The transfer will move to the Completed tab with a Problem status.  If the transfer is recurring, the next occurrence will be generated.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Batch_Over_Daily_Limit" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=50048" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Batch_Outbound_NSF</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-14T20:07:07.032Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Batch Outbound NSF</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">The memopost process will process an otherwise valid outbound external transfer that is for an amount greater than the source account's authorized balance.  The transfer status will be updated to Problem and it will be displayed in the Completed tab.  The transaction will not display in the MLFI screen.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Batch_Outbound_NSF" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=50045" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Batch_Over_Transaction_Limit</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-14T20:08:07.276Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Batch Over Transaction Limit</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">If a scheduled external transfer is over the customer's transaction limit for that transfer type, the memopost batch process will not memopost the transfer to the host.  The transfer will move to the completed tab with a status of Problem.  If the transfer is recurring, the next occurrence will be generated.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Batch_Over_Transaction_Limit" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=50042" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/AUTO_Account_Transactions</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-14T21:23:47.359Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">AUTO Account Transactions</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Verify that the account transactions displayed for an AUTO account are correct.

 This is applicable for POLB and BOLB.
 This is applicable for all affiliates.
 This is common code.

 AUTO</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/AUTO_Account_Transactions" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=49864" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/HECL_Account_Transactions</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-14T21:27:47.910Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">HECL Account Transactions</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Verify that the account transactions displayed for a HECL account are correct.

 This is applicable for POLB and BOLB.
 This is applicable for all affiliates.
 This is common code.

 HECL</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/HECL_Account_Transactions" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=49884" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/EAP_-_Transfer,_no_code_required,_account</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-15T17:23:00.686Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">EAP - Transfer, no code required, account</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">If a customer is enrolled in EAP and they submit a transfer of a type that is NOT enabled, for an amount that is greater than any of the thresholds, the customer will not be required to submit a code to complete the transfer.

 This is common code.
 This is valid for POLB an BOLB customers at all banks.

 EAP is used for internal, external and deposit only transfers for POLB customers
 EAP is used for interna and deposit only transfers for BOLB customers.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/EAP_-_Transfer,_no_code_required,_account" title="" type="application/xml"/>

  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/urn:com.ibm.rqm:testcase:112830</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2018-02-23T06:50:18.628Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">CL Access and Transaction Rules</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">For Commercial Loans sourced by BaNCS the customer's view and transaction access rights are controlled by the Channel Access Flag and Channel Access Apply Flag. These are maintained and managed by BaNCS

The Channel Access field (values F,N,O,T or V) defines the access rights at the Product level.

Channel Access Flag Values:

F: Debits & view only
N: No access allowed
O: All access allowed
T: Credits & view only
V: View only access

The Channel Access flag is a static parameter for a product and the BaNCS system enforces standard Product access rights across all Affiliate banks.

For further granularity, based on dynamic rules, an additional access flag (ChannelAccessApply) is also provided at the account level by BaNCS. This flag further restricts access in specific cases e.g. Matured Line of Credit. 

1: NO Access
2: View Only – No Transactions
3: View and Make Advances
4: View and Make Payments
5: ALL Access – View, Payments & Advances

The second level flag is an override that is intended to be more restrictive than Channel Access Flag.

Online Banking (batch and real-time) will look at both flags and apply the MOST RESTRICTIVE when determining the customer access.

For the details of the rules implemented by BaNCS reference the linked excel file 'Channel Access Apply Rules.xls' (source:  BaNCS OB Batch Extract File Interface Specification: IOF-223-OLBK-01-B06 CL Interface)

These rules cover the following situations:

Contingent Account (e.g. Letter of Credit)
Participation purchased or syndication member
Fully Charged Off Loan
Rate Options
Loan is “Blocked” (e.g. fraud suspect)
Loan is assigned to SAG (Special Assets Group)(Without Conditional Approval)
Loan is Paid Off
Matured Term Loan (with a balloon)(Without Conditional Approval)
Matured Line of Credit(Without Conditional Approval)
Line of Credit becomes Matured  (With Conditional Approval)
Line of Credit becomes > 30 Days Past Due (With Conditional Approval)
Loan assigned a PD Grade of 12 or more (With Conditional Approval)
Loan Placed on Non-Accrual (With Conditional Approval)
Matured Term Loan (with a balloon)  (With Conditional Approval)
Loan is in Bankruptcy
Term Loans
Non-Revolving Lines of Credit
Budget Enabled” loans – e.g. construction lines of credit
Certain Government Program Loans – e.g. SBA, USDA, EXIM Excludes SBA Express
Borrowing Base Loans
Syndicated Agented Loans
Line of Credit moves into Term Phase
Freeze placed on a Line of Credit
Loan placed into Loss Mitigation
Line of Credit becomes > 30 Days Past Due (Without Conditional Approval)
Loan assigned a PD Grade of 12 or more (Without Conditional Approval)
Loan Placed on Non-Accrual (Without Conditional Approval)
Line of Credit becomes Matured  (Without Conditional Approval)
Loan is assigned to SAG (Special Assets Group)(With Conditional Approval)</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">CL BaNCS Channel Access Updates</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">The BaNCS batch process updates the loan account transaction rights based on the Channel Access flags in the type 1 loan detail record:

 

Data Element	Description	Batch/OB Action
ChannelAcess	Product level flag 	
Stored in OB and updated by batch and web-services and is used to define account level access and transact rules based on Product Type for OB.

Values O;F;T;V;N

ChannelAcessApply	Further restricted level flag based on loan lifecycle, current financial standing	
Stored in OB and updated by batch and web-services  and is used to define account level access and transact rules based on dynamic rules for OB

Values 1;2;3;4;5</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">2.44 SET Create Profile (Text)</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">The following informational text shall be displayed on a new screen. 

The text highlighted in pink shall not be displayed to users who selected to enroll in PC Banking. The text highlighted in gray along with the corresponding requirement(s) below shall only be required if the information is not available from the RCIF profile. Steps will need to be numbered accordingly. Refer to Table 1: Affiliate Names for the affiliate information that shall replace [NAME]. Refer to Table 2: Affiliate #’s for the affiliate information that shall replace [NUMBER]. Refer to Table 3: Affiliate Hours for the affiliate information that shall replace [HOUR].

 

Follow the steps below and then click on ‘Submit’ to complete the enrollment process. 

 

1.       Verify your physical address and primary phone1.

2.       Create a unique Login ID2. 

3.       Enter your mother’s maiden name.

4.       Enter your email address.

5.       Enter your date of birth.

6.       Select a time zone.

 

1 To change your physical address and/or primary phone number, you can submit a request through any one of the following channels:

·         Online Banking - Click on the "Services" tab and select the "Change Address/Email” option.

·         Visit any [NAME] branch location.

·         Call [NUMBER] and speak to a customer service representative during the hours of [HOUR].

2 Login ID’s are case-sensitive, must be between 4 and 30 characters and cannot contain spaces. Login ID cannot be your Social Security Number or contain invalid characters. Invalid characters include:   : * ! ; | / ‘. We recommend that you use both alphabetical and numeric characters for a more secure Login ID.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/12088" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=113528" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
